[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: RemoveOption()] [Last Option Removal] Can sponsor remove all options, leaving voting item with empty options array and making voting impossible? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: AddOptions()] [Batch Limit Bypass] At line 318, options are validated individually by AssertOption(), then added at line 319. Can total exceed MaximumOptionsCount by adding many options in single batch? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: AddOptions()] [Limit Check Timing] At lines 320-321, count check happens AFTER AddRange(). If adding options causes count to exceed 64, is revert guaranteed or can state be partially corrupted? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: AddOptions()] [Duplicate Within Batch] If input.Options contains duplicates within same batch, will AssertOption() at line 318 catch them, or only check against existing options? (Medium)
[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: AddOptions()] [Empty Batch] If input.Options is empty array, does function succeed trivially without validation, wasting gas? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: RemoveOptions()] [Partial Removal Failure] At lines 330-335, each option is validated and removed individually. If one option doesn't exist, does entire batch fail or only that option? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: RemoveOptions()] [Vote Orphaning Batch] Can sponsor remove multiple options at once, orphaning all votes for those options simultaneously and corrupting voting results? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Function: RemoveOptions()] [State Consistency] At line 337, votingItem is written back after all removals. Can partial state update occur if transaction reverts mid-removal? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: Register() + Vote()] [Race Condition] Can attacker register voting item and immediately vote before whitelist check propagates, locking tokens in invalid voting item? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: Vote() + Withdraw()] [Double-Spend] Can attacker vote with tokens, immediately withdraw to unlock, then vote again with same tokens in different voting item? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: Vote() + TakeSnapshot()] [Vote Timing Exploit] Can sponsor collude with voter to delay TakeSnapshot() until favorable votes are cast, then immediately take snapshot? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: AddOption() + Vote()] [Option Injection Attack] Can sponsor add option with same name as existing option after votes are cast, causing vote misattribution? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: RemoveOption() + Vote()] [Option Removal DOS] Can sponsor repeatedly add and remove options while voting is active, causing voter confusion and DOS? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: Multiple Vote()] [Quadratic Counter Manipulation] For quadratic voting, QuadraticVotesCountMap at line 100 increments per vote. If VoteId generation has collision (line 397), can counter be manipulated? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: Vote() + UpdateVotingResult()] [Results Overflow] If UpdateVotingResult() at line 177 overflows due to large votes, and Vote() at line 119 succeeds, is state left inconsistent? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: Withdraw() + UpdateVotingResult()] [Underflow in Results] If Withdraw() subtracts at line 216 but vote was never properly added due to bug, can Results[option] underflow? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Cross-Function: Register() + TakeSnapshot()] [Immediate Snapshot Attack] Can sponsor register voting item and immediately take all snapshots before anyone votes, making voting item unusable? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [State: VotingRecords Mapping] At line 117, VotingRecords[VoteId] can be overwritten. Can attacker control VoteId generation to overwrite legitimate votes? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [State: VotedItemsMap Concurrency] At lines 148 and 212, VotedItemsMap is read-modified-written. Can concurrent transactions corrupt this state? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [State: QuadraticVotesCountMap] At line 100-101, counter increments without checking for overflow. Can attacker vote unlimited times causing counter overflow? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [State: VotingResults Persistence] At lines 180 and 222, VotingResults are updated. Can race condition between Vote() and Withdraw() corrupt vote counts? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [State: VotingItems Immutability] VotingItems at line 54 can be modified by AddOption/RemoveOption after creation. Should voting items be immutable after voting starts? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Token: Whitelist Check Timing] At lines 29-34, token whitelist is checked during registration. Can token be removed from whitelist after registration but before voting? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Token: Lock Without Balance Check] At lines 124-130, tokens are locked without checking if voter has sufficient balance. Can this cause lock to fail silently? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Vote/VoteContract.cs] [Token: Unlock Failure Handling] At lines 225-231, token unlock is called but failure not handled. If unlock reverts, is vote still withdrawn? (High)
